page.title: 14Parkgate Buildings
page.content: PARKGATE BUILDINGS ****************** {Ye Watche House-}an unusual building which stands on the Parade opposite the middle slipway.It juts out into the road making it very narrow.In years gone by it was the Watch Tower {used by coastguards looking for {smuggling activities and shipping {problems}in the estuary since there were no navigation lights. {The Boathouse Restaurant-}has been the site of several buildings of different names _Pengwern Arms,Ferry House,and Boathouse Inn, but each has been involved in hostelry.As most names suggest,{in the past a ferry boat left {here for Flint and Bagillt}and along with the horse-drawn coaches provided transport for people of Wirral and North Wales
